Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: investors call that dilution and usually it scares them

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if you are purely a future miner, then that doesn't worry you

Content: I'm thinking as it as a miner

Author: Alright#0419
Content: "Will i actually want to mine this?"

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: in theory, BTCH will easily fit into any znomp mining pool, there won't be technical issues to add it, like Verus

Author: Alright#0419
Content: yea, it's straight forward

Author: Alright#0419
Content: works like any other coin

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i think miners would always like more options

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and BTCH will be another option for z9's, and they can switch their miners to it if they want to specmine or when the price/difficulty is attractive to them

Author: Alright#0419
Content: make it POS? kind of appeases HODLers

Author: Alright#0419
Content: Another reason to make it POS is that it will likely detract from HUSH and KMD's hash rate

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i am not against it, it just sounds like a lot of work üòÉ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and every new zcash fork that comes out, in theory, detracts from Hush/KMD hashrate. But we have asics flooding the market, so hashrates are increasing anyway

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: mining BTCH will open a lot of doors, but long-term, what could bring a lot of inherent value to BTCH, is cryptoconditions

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if BTCH can do CC/smart contract stuff and talk to other KMD asset chains, well that is really freaking cool. That is unique to BTCH, Hush can't do that stuff (but maybe one day)

Content: that's how I took it though

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i really like it, it sounds like it gives BTCH a reason to live, a unique purpose that sets it aside. And it's a resource to other AC's, and we keep getting more

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if we changed supply to 147M, then current supply would be 1/7th of total, which leaves about 86% to be mined. Just a datapoint, i think bringing a few different options to the community and seeing how the feel is going to happen soon, maybe some kind of vote

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if we don't have to change the satoshi amounts of any address, that makes the whole process a lot easier

Content: There needs to be a more immediate "need" for the coin for it to get some traction.   I like the MoMoM btc headers idea but how long til there is a enough cross chain contracts that would utilize it .  Needs a renaming too.

Content: I think @Alright is right I‚Äôm thinking we need a high % of PoW blocks to come, so that miners will be interested. And clearly James‚Äôs headers idea is brilliant as well. I think your idea of 147mil coins @dukeleto sounds nice. Or something around that range. Some good halving points count be used as well to keep the PoW alive for years to come, like BTC.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what about a 50% PoS and 50% PoW chain? that would allow the people will active stakes to maintain their percentage of total supply, while also allowing new miners to also achieve large positions

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the ultimate coin supply would be secondary with a 50/50 chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: can also be 60/40 or 40/60, etc

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: That sounds like the best option

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I am not sure exactly how we would do 50% PoS/PoW, but it sounds interesting. Verus has certainly done a lot of work in the area that could be built upon

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: has any coin forked from 100% PoW to 50% PoS/PoW? It would be interesting to see how the went about it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: -ac_staked=50 <- 50% PoS

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: -ac_staked=60 <- 60% PoS

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: pretty easy to set the PoS/PoW percentage

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD has -ac_staked option before verus, which uses a totally difrerent method of balancing. we have tested 90%, 100%, 50%, 10% and a few other -ac_staked percentages and unless there is another attack vector found, we should be good at any percentage.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I think using the -ac_* options quite a large percentage of all the other coin emissions can be replicated,plus a lot of new ones

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: @dukeleto we're about to start a new PoS/PoW chain for testing in Chips #pos64test channel

Author: dukeleto#7326

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content:
Just an idea - but it would be nice to be able to build an "assetchain" -cli direct from the source (btch-cli).
Using the command switches from the komodo-cli makes integration into existing add-ons (like wallets) an extra step most don't want to take.
Same is true of the daemon - having to create a scrip or remember startup switches is tedious - it must be possible to add these to the build script - a Bounty opportunity?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Bar_F1sh_Rel cd src/; ./fiat/btch help

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: all assetchains have a ./fiat/ac wrapper

Author: Bar_F1sh_Rel#0834
Content:
@dukeleto - yeah - but that is still just a script call to komodo-cli with wildcards accepted.
What is needed is a native btch-cli - as the wrapped script breaks calls in GUI's like swing.

Author: pbca26#5430
Content:
i think verus already done something similar in verusd and verus-cli
but it will only work on mac/linux and those are also just a few shell scripts

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Bar_F1sh_Rel `as the wrapped script breaks calls in GUI's like swing` sounds like a bug in the GUI

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: verus-cli is just a wrapper around komodo-cli

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
I came up with an MGW CC contract and plan to use BTCH to be the chain where the BTC token is issued. with the built in DEX for onchain assets against BTCH, it can create a good solution for speedy trading. it is a single chain atomic swap DEX
the redeem will be a transfer of the BTC assets back to real BTC, which will rely on user specified notaries
eventually can make it so the BTCH BTC token can be transferred to other CC enabled chains, but that would likely be next year

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <noashh> y

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <halo kitty rules> @Takoy_Nahal raise transaction fees. Some (semi-centralized) currencies work that way. IOTA and Waves are examples. Other way would probably be to burn unclaimed coins. How many of them have been claimed already? 10% of total supply? Set a time limit of 6 or 12 months and than burn unclaimed. From that point on you can probably continue with POW. Otherwise BTCH airdrop make no sense. Also, current name of coin is Bitcoin Hush. Bitcoin-Hush. Bitcoin. We all know what is maximum supply for BTC. ZEC (BTC's fork) and HUSH (ZEC's fork) remain with 21 mio. It's part of identity and it should be part of promotion and marketing.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> I'm not a developer, maybe your idea is sound. But it's still fork Komodo, and KMD is already 100 million, but its value in the bear market is not low

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <halo kitty rules> I'm also not a developer. BTCH is not KMD fork, it is KMD asset chain. With total suppy of BTCH market capitalization would be 1-3 million, with circulating supply it is some 100k $. Tell BTC whales (centralized exchanges) you will burn their shitcoin and some will claim it and do something with it. That is a way to increase market volume and price and it no longer is shitcoin. And even if 25 or 50 % of BTCH would be claimed it will still leave significant room for POW. Also you should know that 5-6 million of already mined BTC is lost in space, so nobady will claim those forks.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Takoy_Nahal> @halo kitty rules Yes you are right< my mistake, asset chain. I think we will know about it soon
